templates.name: Fixer
templates.description: A shadow broker who connects runners with jobs, gear, and information.

templates.name: Street Doc
templates.description: An underground medical professional who asks no questions.

templates.name: Arms Dealer
templates.description: A supplier of weapons, ammo, and military-grade hardware.

templates.name: Talismonger
templates.description: A dealer in magical supplies, foci, and reagents.

templates.name: Info Broker
templates.description: A specialist in gathering and selling secrets and paydata.

templates.name: Mr. Johnson
templates.description: A corporate agent who hires runners for deniable assets operations.

templates.name: Mechanic
templates.description: A skilled technician who repairs and modifies vehicles and drones.

templates.name: Beat Cop
templates.description: A law enforcement officer willing to look the other way or share tips.

templates.name: Gang Leader
templates.description: The head of a local street gang or organized crime cell.

templates.name: Smuggler
templates.description: A transporter of illicit goods and people across borders.

powers.name: Adrenaline Boost
powers.description: +2 Initiative Score per level for the current Combat Turn. Take Drain equal to levels at beginning of next turn.

powers.name: Astral Perception
powers.description: See into the astral plane. Dual-natured while active, can attack astral forms.

powers.name: Attribute Boost
powers.description: Boost a Physical Attribute. Make Magic + Rating Test; each hit boosts attribute by 1. Lasts 2x hits Combat Turns. Drain equal to level afterward.

powers.name: Combat Sense
powers.description: +1 defense pool per level against ranged/melee attacks. Always get Perception Test before surprise.

powers.name: Critical Strike
powers.description: +1 DV with the selected melee skill. May purchase multiple times for different skills.

powers.name: Danger Sense
powers.description: +1 die per level on Surprise Tests.

powers.name: Enhanced Perception
powers.description: +1 die per level to all Perception and Assensing Tests.

powers.name: Enhanced Accuracy
powers.description: +1 Accuracy with the selected Combat Skill. Cannot use with Unarmed Combat.

powers.name: Improved Ability
powers.description: +1 skill rating per level. Max improvement = current skill × 1.5 (round up). Must know the skill.

powers.name: Improved Physical Attribute
powers.description: Permanently increase a Physical Attribute by 1 per level, up to augmented maximum.

powers.name: Improved Potential
powers.description: Raise one inherent limit by 1 per level. May purchase once per limit.

powers.name: Improved Reflexes
powers.description: Increase Reaction and Initiative Dice. Cannot combine with other Initiative enhancements.

powers.name: Improved Sense
powers.description: Gain a sensory enhancement not normal for your metatype.

powers.name: Killing Hands
powers.description: Unarmed attacks may cause Physical damage. Attacks are magical and bypass Immunity to Normal Weapons.

powers.name: Kinesics
powers.description: +1 per level to resist Social Tests and tests to read emotions (Judge Intentions, assensing, etc.).

powers.name: Light Body
powers.description: Add level to Agility for jump distance. +1 die per level to Gymnastics for jumps. Reduce fall damage by level meters.

powers.name: Missile Parry
powers.description: +1 defense die per level vs slow projectiles (arrows, knives, grenades). Net hits = catch missile.

powers.name: Mystic Armor
powers.description: +1 Armor per level. Stacks with other armor, no encumbrance. Protects in astral combat.

powers.name: Natural Immunity
powers.description: +1 die per level to resist toxins and disease.

powers.name: Pain Resistance
powers.description: Wound modifiers start 1 box later per level. +2 dice per level to resist torture/pain.

powers.name: Rapid Healing
powers.description: You recover from damage more quickly, magically healing yourself over periods of time. Add +1 die per level to your Body for Healing Tests. Also add +1 die per level to any tests made to heal you through magical or mundane means (such as a Heal spell or the First Aid skill), whether the attempt is made by you or another character.

powers.name: Spell Resistance
powers.description: +1 die per level to resist spells, rituals, preparations, and Innate Spell critter powers.

powers.name: Traceless Walk
powers.description: Leave no visible traces. -4 hearing Perception to detect. Don't trip pressure/vibration sensors. -2 to Track Tests.

powers.name: Voice Control
powers.description: Control voice pitch, tone, volume. +level to Impersonation. +level to Social limit.

powers.name: Wall Running
powers.description: Run up vertical surfaces. Running + Strength [Magic] Test = meters climbed per action.

metatypes.name: Human
metatypes.description: The most common metatype, humans are versatile and adaptable with higher Edge potential.

metatypes.name: Elf
metatypes.description: Graceful and charismatic, elves possess enhanced agility and social abilities along with low-light vision.

metatypes.name: Dwarf
metatypes.description: Sturdy and resilient, dwarves are shorter but stronger with natural resistance to toxins.

metatypes.name: Ork
metatypes.description: Physically powerful with enhanced strength and endurance, orks have low-light vision but reduced mental limits.

metatypes.name: Troll
metatypes.description: Massive and tough, trolls have the highest physical attributes, natural armor, and extended reach.

primaryAttributes.name: Body
primaryAttributes.description: Physical toughness, resistance to damage and illness.

primaryAttributes.name: Agility
primaryAttributes.description: Coordination, balance, and fine motor skills.

primaryAttributes.name: Reaction
primaryAttributes.description: Reflex speed and ability to respond to sudden changes.

primaryAttributes.name: Strength
primaryAttributes.description: Raw physical power and lifting capacity.

primaryAttributes.name: Willpower
primaryAttributes.description: Mental fortitude, determination, and resistance to mental manipulation.

primaryAttributes.name: Logic
primaryAttributes.description: Analytical thinking, memory, and deductive reasoning.

primaryAttributes.name: Intuition
primaryAttributes.description: Gut instincts, perception, and ability to read situations.

primaryAttributes.name: Charisma
primaryAttributes.description: Force of personality, persuasiveness, and social presence.

specialAttributes.name: Edge
specialAttributes.description: Luck and ability to push outcomes in your favor.

specialAttributes.name: Essence
specialAttributes.description: Measure of life force, reduced by cyberware and bioware.

specialAttributes.name: Magic
specialAttributes.description: Magical aptitude. Only available to Awakened characters.

specialAttributes.name: Resonance
specialAttributes.description: Connection to the Resonance. Only available to Technomancers.

derivedAttributes.name: Physical Condition Monitor
derivedAttributes.description: Boxes of physical damage before overflow.

derivedAttributes.name: Stun Condition Monitor
derivedAttributes.description: Boxes of stun damage before unconsciousness.

categories.name: Metatype
categories.description: Determines available metatypes and special attribute points.

categories.name: Attributes
categories.description: Points to distribute among physical and mental attributes.

categories.name: Skills
categories.description: Skill points and skill group points.

categories.name: Resources
categories.description: Starting nuyen for gear and lifestyle.

paths.name: Magician
paths.description: Full magical practitioner with access to all magical skills and abilities.

paths.name: Mystic Adept
paths.description: Combines magical abilities with adept powers. Cannot astrally project.

paths.name: Adept
paths.description: Channels magic internally for physical enhancement.

paths.name: Aspected Magician
paths.description: Magician limited to one magical skill group (Sorcery, Conjuring, or Enchanting).

paths.name: Technomancer
paths.description: Naturally interfaces with the Matrix through Resonance.

combat.name: Acid Stream
combat.description: Creates a powerful corrosive stream that sprays the target, causing terrible burns and eating away organic and metallic material. Treat as Acid damage.

combat.name: Toxic Wave
combat.description: Area version of Acid Stream. Creates a powerful corrosive wave that sprays targets, causing terrible burns and eating away organic and metallic material.

combat.name: Punch
combat.description: Smacks the target with invisible psychokinetic force, similar to a bruising punch, inflicting Stun damage. Requires touching the target.

combat.name: Clout
combat.description: Smacks the target with invisible psychokinetic force, similar to a bruising punch, inflicting Stun damage at range.

combat.name: Blast
combat.description: Area version of Clout. Smacks targets with invisible psychokinetic force, inflicting Stun damage.

combat.name: Death Touch
combat.description: Channels destructive magical power into the target, doing Physical damage. Only affects living and magical targets. Requires touching the target.

combat.name: Manabolt
combat.description: Channels destructive magical power into the target, doing Physical damage. Only affects living and magical targets.

combat.name: Manaball
combat.description: Area version of Manabolt. Channels destructive magical power into targets, doing Physical damage.

combat.name: Flamethrower
combat.description: Creates an explosion of flames that scorch the target, dealing Fire damage. May ignite flammable materials.

combat.name: Fireball
combat.description: Area version of Flamethrower. Creates an explosion of flames that scorch targets, dealing Fire damage.

combat.name: Lightning Bolt
combat.description: Creates and directs a vicious strike of electricity that causes Electricity damage.

combat.name: Ball Lightning
combat.description: Area version of Lightning Bolt. Creates vicious strikes of electricity that cause Electricity damage.

combat.name: Shatter
combat.description: Channels destructive magical power into the target causing Physical damage. Affects living and non-living targets. Requires touching the target.

combat.name: Powerbolt
combat.description: Channels destructive magical power into the target causing Physical damage. Affects living and non-living targets.

combat.name: Powerball
combat.description: Area version of Powerbolt. Channels destructive magical power into targets causing Physical damage.

combat.name: Knockout
combat.description: Channels magical energy directly into the target, causing Stun damage. Requires touching the target.

combat.name: Stunbolt
combat.description: Channels magical energy directly into the target, causing Stun damage.

combat.name: Stunball
combat.description: Area version of Stunbolt. Channels magical energy directly into targets, causing Stun damage.

detection.name: Analyze Device
detection.description: Allows the subject to analyze the purpose and operation of a device or piece of equipment within range.

detection.name: Analyze Magic
detection.description: Allows the subject to analyze the purpose of a magical object (e.g., foci, alchemical preparations, magical lodges).

detection.name: Analyze Truth
detection.description: The subject can tell whether a target’s statements are the truth (or at least if the subject honestly believes them to be true).

detection.name: Clairaudience
detection.description: The subject can hear distant sounds as if physically present at a chosen point within the sensory range of the spell.

detection.name: Clairvoyance
detection.description: The subject can see distant scenes as if physically present at a chosen point within the sensory range of the spell.

detection.name: Combat Sense
detection.description: Subject can subconsciously analyze combat situations. Every hit adds 1 die to Reaction on Surprise Tests and defense tests.

detection.name: Detect Enemies
detection.description: The subject can sense the presence of living things within range that have hostile intentions.

detection.name: Detect Enemies, Extended
detection.description: Extended range version of Detect Enemies.

detection.name: Detect Individual
detection.description: The subject can detect the presence of a particular individual anywhere within range.

detection.name: Detect Life
detection.description: The subject can detect all living beings within range of the sense and knows their number and relative location.

detection.name: Detect Life, Extended
detection.description: Extended range version of Detect Life.

detection.name: Detect Magic
detection.description: The subject can detect the presence of all foci, spells, wards, magical lodges, and spirits within range.

detection.name: Detect Magic, Extended
detection.description: Extended range version of Detect Magic.

detection.name: Mindlink
detection.description: Allows the magician and one voluntary subject to communicate mentally.

detection.name: Mind Probe
detection.description: Allows the subject to telepathically probe the mind of a specific target within range.

health.name: Antidote
health.description: Helps a poisoned subject overcome a toxin. Add hits to Toxin Resistance Test.

health.name: Cure Disease
health.description: Helps a patient overcome illness. Adds dice to Disease Resistance Test.

health.name: Decrease [Attribute]
health.description: Weakens the target by decreasing a designated Attribute.

health.name: Detox
health.description: Relieves the side effects of a drug or poison. Eliminates symptoms.

health.name: Heal
health.description: Repairs physical injuries. Heals Physical damage damage equal to hits.

health.name: Increase [Attribute]
health.description: Increases an Attribute (natural or augmented) on a voluntary subject.

health.name: Increase Reflexes
health.description: Increases initiative. Each hit adds +1 Initiative, every 2 hits adds +1d6.

health.name: Oxygenate
health.description: Oxygenates the blood, providing extra Body dice to resist suffocation and allowing underwater breathing.

health.name: Prophylaxis
health.description: Provides extra dice to resist infection, drugs, or toxins.

health.name: Resist Pain
health.description: Allows subject to ignore pain penalties from Physical or Stun damage.

health.name: Stabilize
health.description: Stabilizes all vital functions and prevents the character from dying from Physical overflow.

illusion.name: Agony
illusion.description: Inflicts an illusion of terrible pain. Hits cause pseudo-damage.

illusion.name: Bugs
illusion.description: Makes target believe they are covered in bugs. Reduces Initiative Score.

illusion.name: Confusion
illusion.description: Produces a storm of conflicting sensations. Target suffers dice pool penalty.

illusion.name: Chaos
illusion.description: Physical version of Confusion. Affects technological systems too.

illusion.name: Entertainment
illusion.description: Creates obvious, but entertaining, illusions in the minds of subjects.

illusion.name: Trid Entertainment
illusion.description: Physical version of Entertainment. Creates obvious illusions perceivable by sensors.

illusion.name: Invisibility
illusion.description: Makes subject difficult to detect by normal visual senses (living minds only).

illusion.name: Improved Invisibility
illusion.description: Makes subject difficult to detect by visual senses (affects cameras/sensors).

illusion.name: Mask
illusion.description: Subject assumes a different physical appearance in the minds of viewers.

illusion.name: Physical Mask
illusion.description: Subject assumes a different physical appearance (affects cameras/sensors).

illusion.name: Phantasm
illusion.description: Creates convincing illusions of any object, creature, or scene (living minds only).

illusion.name: Trid Phantasm
illusion.description: Creates convincing illusions of any object, creature, or scene (affects cameras/sensors).

illusion.name: Hush
illusion.description: Creates an area that dampens sound (affects living beings).

illusion.name: Silence
illusion.description: Creates an area that dampens sound (affects technology).

illusion.name: Stealth
illusion.description: Makes the subject less audible to normal and augmented hearing.

manipulation.name: Armor
manipulation.description: Creates a glowing field of magical energy that protects against Physical Damage. Adds Armor.

manipulation.name: Control Actions
manipulation.description: Controls the physical actions of the target like a puppeteer.

manipulation.name: Control Thoughts
manipulation.description: Seizes control of the target's mind, directing everything they think.

manipulation.name: Fling
manipulation.description: Psychokinetically hurls a single object at a target.

manipulation.name: Ice Sheet
manipulation.description: Creates a slippery sheet of ice over the area.

manipulation.name: Ignite
manipulation.description: Accelerates molecular motion, causing the target to catch fire.

manipulation.name: Influence
manipulation.description: Implants a single suggestion in the victim's mind.

manipulation.name: Levitate
manipulation.description: Allows telekinetic lifting and moving of a person or object.

manipulation.name: Light
manipulation.description: Creates a mobile point of light.

manipulation.name: Magic Fingers
manipulation.description: Creates a psychokinetic effect as a sort of invisible hand.

manipulation.name: Mana Barrier
manipulation.description: Creates an invisible barrier of magical energy that impedes spirits and spells.

manipulation.name: Physical Barrier
manipulation.description: Creates a glowing, translucent force field (wall or dome).

manipulation.name: Poltergeist
manipulation.description: Picks up small objects and whirls them around, causing damage and visibility penalties.

complexForms.name: Diffusion of [Matrix Attribute]
complexForms.description: Lower target's Matrix attribute. Choose attribute when learned.

complexForms.name: Infusion of [Matrix Attribute]
complexForms.description: Boost target's Matrix attribute. Choose attribute when learned.

complexForms.name: Primed Charge
complexForms.description: Add hits to next Matrix action as bonus dice.

complexForms.name: Puppeteer
complexForms.description: Force device to perform a Matrix action.

complexForms.name: Pulse Storm
complexForms.description: Crash all icons in an area.

complexForms.name: Resonance Channel
complexForms.description: Grant sprite ability to use complex forms.

complexForms.name: Resonance Veil
complexForms.description: Make icon appear as something else.

activeSkills.name: Archery
activeSkills.description: Archery is used to fire string-loaded projectile weapons. An archer is familiar with many different styles of bow and the multitude of arrows that can be used to maximum effect.

activeSkills.name: Automatics
activeSkills.description: The Automatics skill covers a specific subset of firearms larger than handheld pistols but smaller than rifles. This category includes submachine guns and other fully automatic carbines.

activeSkills.name: Blades
activeSkills.description: Slice and dice! The Blades skill includes the use of all handheld slashing and stabbing weapons. You can use a range of edged weapons including daggers, swords, and axes.

activeSkills.name: Clubs
activeSkills.description: Clubs governs the use of all hand-held bludgeoning instruments. With this skill you can turn any blunt item, be it a baseball bat, crutch, or mace, into a weapon.

activeSkills.name: Exotic Ranged Weapon
activeSkills.description: Sometimes a regular gun or blade won’t do the job and you need something fancier. Or weirder. This skill must be taken once for each unusual ranged weapon you want to use. Some examples include blowguns, gyrojet pistols, flamethrowers, and lasers.

activeSkills.name: Heavy Weapons
activeSkills.description: The term heavy weapon is designated for all projectile weaponry larger than an assault rifle, such as grenade launchers, machine guns, and assault cannons. This skill is exclusive to handheld and non-vehicle-mounted weaponry—if you’ve got a gun mounted on or in a vehicle, use Gunnery.

activeSkills.name: Longarms
activeSkills.description: The Longarms skill is for firing extended-barrel weapons such as sporting rifles and sniper rifles. This grouping also includes weapons like shotguns that are designed to be braced against the shoulder.

activeSkills.name: Pistols
activeSkills.description: This skill category includes all types of handheld pistols, including tasers, single-shots, semi-automatics, and revolvers.

activeSkills.name: Throwing Weapons
activeSkills.description: Throwing Weapons is a broad-based attack skill that can be used for any handheld item that is thrown by the user as a weapon.

activeSkills.name: Unarmed Combat
activeSkills.description: Unarmed Combat covers the various self-defense and attack moves that employ the body as a primary weapon. This includes a wide array of martial arts along with the use of cybernetic implant weaponry and the fighting styles that sprung up around those implants.

activeSkills.name: Disguise
activeSkills.description: Disguise covers non-magical forms of masking your identity, including makeup and enhancement. See Using Disguise and Impersonation, p. 136.

activeSkills.name: Diving
activeSkills.description: Diving brings together a wide array of actions performed underwater. This skill can be applied when diving, swimming underwater, using complex diving equipment, and holding your breath.

activeSkills.name: Escape Artist
activeSkills.description: Escape Artist measures the character’s ability to escape from bindings by using body contortion and manual dexterity. See Using Escape Artist, p. 135.

activeSkills.name: Free-Fall
activeSkills.description: This skill covers any jump from height, including leaps from a third-floor window to jumps from a plane at high altitude. If it involves any kind of attempt to slow or control your fall, this covers it, so it includes skydiving with a parachute, flying a wingsuit, or descending on a line, bungee cord, or zipline.

activeSkills.name: Gymnastics
activeSkills.description: Gymnastics measures your balance, general athleticism, and all-around ability to use your body. For more information on ways Gymnastics may be applied in-game, see Jumping, p. 134.

activeSkills.name: Palming
activeSkills.description: Palming is sleight-of-hand skill that gives a character the ability to snag, hide, and pass off small objects.

activeSkills.name: Perception
activeSkills.description: Perception refers to the ability to spot anomalies in everyday situations, making it one of the key skills a shadowrunner needs. See Using Perception, p. 135.

activeSkills.name: Running
activeSkills.description: Running, as you may guess, is about how much ground you can cover quickly. For more information see Using Running, p. 136.

activeSkills.name: Sneaking
activeSkills.description: Need to get where you’re not supposed to be? This skill allows you to remain inconspicuous in various situations. See Using Stealth Skills, p. 136.

activeSkills.name: Survival
activeSkills.description: In the desert with nothing more than a tin cup, a poncho, and an iron rod? You’ll need this skill to help you get out alive. Survival is the ability to stay alive in extreme environmental conditions for extended periods of time. The skill governs a character’s ability to perform vital outdoor tasks such as start a fire, build a shelter, scrounge for food, etc. in hostile environments. See Using Survival, p. 136.

activeSkills.name: Swimming
activeSkills.description: This skill determines the character’s ability to swim in various bodies of water. The skill level affects the distance and speed at which a character can swim. See Using Swimming, p. 137

activeSkills.name: Tracking
activeSkills.description: This skill confers the ability to detect the passage of metahumans and other game through terrain and use those clues to follow that individual. This skill also allows you to identify unmarked trails and common game paths is various environments. See Using Tracking, p. 137.

activeSkills.name: Con
activeSkills.description: Con governs the ability to manipulate or fool an NPC during a social encounter. This skill covers a range of confidence games as well as the principles behind those cons.

activeSkills.name: Etiquette
activeSkills.description: Etiquette represents the level of understanding and awareness of proper social rituals. The skill works as a sort of social version of Sneak, allowing you to move unimpeded through various social situations. Etiquette also serves as a social safety net in case a player botches a social situation in a way a skilled character would not. See Using Etiquette, p. 141.

activeSkills.name: Impersonation
activeSkills.description: Impersonation is the ability to assume the identity of another person, including voice and physical mannerisms. The skill is limited by the physical abilities of the character. A dwarf might be able to impersonate a troll over a commlink, but the illusion shatters when he is face to face with his target.

activeSkills.name: Instruction
activeSkills.description: Instruction governs the ability to teach people. The skill level helps determine how comfortable the instructor is delivering new material as well as how complex of a skill may be taught. See Using Instruction, p. 141.

activeSkills.name: Intimidation
activeSkills.description: Intimidation is about creating the impression that you are more menacing than another person in order to get them to do what you want. The skill may be applied multiple ways, from negotiation to interrogation. Intimidation is an Opposed Intimidation + Charisma [Social] Test against the target’s Charisma + Willpower, modified by the appropriate entries on the Social Modifiers Table (p. 140).

activeSkills.name: Leadership
activeSkills.description: Leadership is the ability to direct and motivate others. It’s like Con, except rather than using deception you’re using a position of authority. This skill is especially helpful in situations where the will of a teammate is shaken or someone is being asked to do something uncomfortable. The Leadership skill is not meant to replace or make up for poor teamwork. When using Leadership make an opposed test Charisma + Leadership. See Using Social Influence Skills, at right, for test modifiers.

activeSkills.name: Negotiation
activeSkills.description: Negotiation governs a character’s ability to apply their charisma, tactics, and knowledge of situational psychology in order to create a better position when making deals.

activeSkills.name: Performance
activeSkills.description: This skill governs the ability to execute a performing art. Performance is to the arts what Artisan is to craft. The performer uses her skill to entertain or even captivate an audience. See Using Performance, p. 141.

activeSkills.name: Alchemy
activeSkills.description: Alchemy is used to create substances that store spells. Alchemy is most commonly used to brew potions, distill magical reagents, and even create orichalcum.

activeSkills.name: Arcana
activeSkills.description: Arcana governs the creation of magical formulae used to create spells, foci, and all other manner of magical manipulations. Arcana is required to understand formulae that may be purchased over the counter or discovered by other means.

activeSkills.name: Artificing
activeSkills.description: Artificing is the process of crafting magical foci. The skill may also be used forensically, in order to assense qualities about an existing focus’ creation and purpose. See Artificing p. 306.

activeSkills.name: Assensing
activeSkills.description: Assensing is a magic user’s ability to read and interpret fluctuations in the astral world. This skill allows practitioners to learn information by reading astral auras. Only characters capable of astral perception may take this skill. For more information, see Astral Perception, p. 312

activeSkills.name: Astral Combat
activeSkills.description: Fighting in Astral Space requires the Astral Combat skill. Combat in the Astral World relies on a very different set of abilities and attributes than physical combatants. See Astral Combat, p. 315.

activeSkills.name: Banishing
activeSkills.description: Banishing is used to disrupt the link between spirits and the physical world. Banished spirits are forced to return to their native plane and are no longer required to complete unfulfilled services.

activeSkills.name: Binding
activeSkills.description: Binding is used to compel a summoned spirit to perform a number of additional services. See Binding, p. 300.

activeSkills.name: Counterspelling
activeSkills.description: Counterspelling is a defensive skill used to defend against magical attacks and dispel sustained magical spells. See Counterspelling, p. 294.

activeSkills.name: Disenchanting
activeSkills.description: This skill governs a character’s ability to remove the enchantment from an item. See Disenchanting, p. 307.

activeSkills.name: Ritual Spellcasting
activeSkills.description: Ritual spellcasting is a spellcasting skill used to cast ritual spells. See Ritual Spellcasting, p. 295.

activeSkills.name: Spellcasting
activeSkills.description: The Spellcasting skill permits the character to channel mana into effects known as spells. See Spellcasting, p. 281.

activeSkills.name: Summoning
activeSkills.description: This skill is used to summon spirits. See Summoning, p. 300).

activeSkills.name: Compiling
activeSkills.description: Compiling involves the ability to translate the complex 0s and 1s of machine source language and the rhythms of the resonance into sprites. See Sprites, p. 254.

activeSkills.name: Decompiling
activeSkills.description: Decompiling is a character’s ability to effectively delete previously compiled sprites. See Sprites, p. 254.

activeSkills.name: Registering
activeSkills.description: This skill allows a technomancer to register sprites on the Matrix, thereby convincing the grids that they are legitimate. See Sprites, p. 254.

activeSkills.name: Aeronautics Mechanic
activeSkills.description: Aeronautics mechanics have the ability to repair a variety of aerospace vehicles, provided the proper tools and parts are available. See Building & Repairing, p. 145.

activeSkills.name: Animal Handling
activeSkills.description: This skill governs the training, care, riding (if they’re big enough), and control of non-sentient animals. Competent trainers have the ability to handle multiple animals. It is even possible to approach an untrained animal and get it to trust you, or at least not eat you.

activeSkills.name: Armorer
activeSkills.description: Armorer encompasses the broad array of skills required to build and maintain weapons and armor. As with all mechanics-based skills, the proper tools and equipment are required to perform any repair or build operation. For thresholds and information on determining success results, see Building & Repairing, p. 145.

activeSkills.name: Artisan
activeSkills.description: This skill includes several different forms of artistic impression as well as the handcrafting of fine objects that would otherwise be produced on an assembly line. The world’s top artists and crafters are considered artisans.

activeSkills.name: Automotive Mechanic
activeSkills.description: Automotive mechanics are tasked with fixing all types of ground-based vehicles ranging from commercial automobiles to wheeled drones to tanks. Repairs require the proper tools and time. See Building & Repairing, p. 145.

activeSkills.name: Biotechnology
activeSkills.description: Biotechnology is a wide-ranging skill primarily used by doctors and scientists to grow organic body parts. This skill is the basis for cloning as well as all forms of bioware. Provided the right equipment is available, biotechnology can be used to repair damaged bioware, clone new tissue, or detect any bioware in a subject’s body. This skill does not allow characters to install or remove bioware.

activeSkills.name: Chemistry
activeSkills.description: Chemistry permits the character to create chemical reactions and develop chemical compounds ranging from drugs, to perfumes, to biopolymers like NuSkin. Chemistry can also be used to analyze chemical compounds to determine what they are.

activeSkills.name: Computer
activeSkills.description: Computer is the base skill for interacting with the Matrix. It represents the ability to use computers and other Matrix-connected devices. The Computer skill focuses on understanding multiple operating systems. It does not allow the character to exploit code (Hacking) or strip down mainframes (Hardware). See Using Computer, p. 226.

activeSkills.name: Cybercombat
activeSkills.description: Cybercombat is the skill used by hackers to engage in combat on the Matrix. See Using Cybercombat, p. 226

activeSkills.name: Cybertechnology
activeSkills.description: Cybertechnology is the ability to create, maintain, and repair cybernetic parts. A character with the proper tools and parts may repair or even build new cybernetics. Cybertechnology is not a surgical skill. Characters cannot attach or re-attach cybernetics to organic material with this skill. This skill may be used to modify or upgrade cybernetics within cyberlimbs. See Building and Repairing, p. 145.

activeSkills.name: Demolitions
activeSkills.description: Demolitions is used to prepare, plant, detonate, and often defuse chemical-based explosives. See Explosives, p. 436.

activeSkills.name: Electronic Warfare
activeSkills.description: Electronic Warfare is the basis of military signals intelligence. It governs the encoding, disruption, spoofing, and decoding of communication systems. Providing the user has the proper equipment, the skill can be used to manipulate or even take over the signal of any item’s communication system. See Using Electronic Warfare, p. 226.

activeSkills.name: First Aid
activeSkills.description: First Aid is the ability to provide emergency medical assistance similar to that of a paramedic. This skill may be used to stabilize wounds and prevent characters from dying. First Aid cannot be used to perform surgery or repair damaged implants. For more information, see Healing, p. 205.

activeSkills.name: Forgery
activeSkills.description: Forgery is used to produce counterfeit items or alter existing items to a specific purpose. Depending on the type of forgery, the forger may need specific tools or schematics to complete the task. See Using Forgery, p. 145.

activeSkills.name: Hacking
activeSkills.description: Hacking is used to discover and exploit security flaws in computers and other electronics. For more on how Hacking is used, see Using Hacking, p. 226.

activeSkills.name: Hardware
activeSkills.description: Hardware reflects a characters ability to build and repair electronic devices. A workspace, proper materials, and sufficient build time are required to enact a repair or to build a new device. See Building & Repairing, at right.

activeSkills.name: Industrial Mechanic
activeSkills.description: An industrial mechanic is tasked with repairing or modifying large-scale machines, such as assembly line equipment, power generators, HVAC units, industrial robots, etc. See Building and Repairing, at right.

activeSkills.name: Locksmith
activeSkills.description: This skill covers building, repairing, and opening mechanical and electronic locks. While largely banished to antiquity, traditional mechanical locking mechanisms are still in use around the globe, often as throwbacks or backups. Electronic locks are far more common and quite susceptible to your ministrations. See Doors, Windows, & Locks, p. 363.

activeSkills.name: Medicine
activeSkills.description: Medicine is used to perform advanced medical procedures such as surgeries. It includes long-term medical support for disease and illness, and the skill can be used to diagnose a character’s medical condition. This skill is used to implant or remove cybernetics and bioware but cannot be used to repair or maintain implanted devices. For more information, see Healing, p. 205.

activeSkills.name: Nautical Mechanic
activeSkills.description: Nautical Mechanic is concerned with the maintenance and repair of watercraft. This skill is only effective if the necessary equipment and time are available. See Building & Repairing below.

activeSkills.name: Navigation
activeSkills.description: Navigation governs the use of technology and natural instinct to navigate through territory. This skill enables characters to read maps, use GPS devices, follow AR nav points, or follow a course by landmarks or general direction sense. Navigation applies to both AR and non-AR-enhanced environments.

activeSkills.name: Software
activeSkills.description: Software is the skill used to create and manipulate programming in the Matrix. See Using Software, p. 226. It’s also what technomancers use when they create their complex forms (Threading, p. 251).

activeSkills.name: Gunnery
activeSkills.description: Gunnery is used when firing any vehicle-mounted weapon, regardless of how or where the weapon is mounted. This skill extends to manual and sensor-enhanced gunnery.

activeSkills.name: Pilot Aerospace
activeSkills.description: Aerospace vehicles include all reduced- and zero-gravity aircraft capable of suborbital or extra-orbital flight.

activeSkills.name: Pilot Aircraft
activeSkills.description: This skill is used to pilot any manned or unmanned aircraft operating solely within planetary atmosphere.

activeSkills.name: Pilot Walker
activeSkills.description: Any vehicle that walks on two or more legs is piloted through this skill. Characters may control the walker physically or remotely.

activeSkills.name: Pilot Exotic Vehicle
activeSkills.description: Characters must take this skill one time for each specific exotic vehicle. Characters may control the vehicle remotely with this skill where possible.

activeSkills.name: Pilot Ground Craft
activeSkills.description: This skill is used to pilot any ground-based vehicle, excluding legged vehicles. This skill applies whether the pilot is in the vehicle or controlling the vehicle via remote access.

activeSkills.name: Pilot Watercraft
activeSkills.description: This skill is used to pilot any waterborne vehicle, whether from inside it or by remote control.

positive.name: Ambidextrous
positive.summary: Ignore off-hand penalties; both hands treated equally.

positive.name: Analytical Mind
positive.summary: +2 dice to Logic tests involving pattern analysis.

positive.name: Aptitude
positive.summary: Raise one skill max to 7 at creation, 13 after.

positive.name: Astral Chameleon
positive.summary: Astral signature lasts half as long; –2 to others Assensing you.

positive.name: Bilingual
positive.summary: Gain a second native language.

positive.name: Blandness
positive.summary: Audience Threshold +1 to remember you; –2 to Shadow/Locate tests.

positive.name: Catlike
positive.summary: +2 dice to Sneaking tests.

positive.name: Codeslinger
positive.summary: +2 dice to one chosen Matrix action.

positive.name: Double-Jointed
positive.summary: +2 dice to Escape Artist; fit into tight spaces.

positive.name: Exceptional Attribute
positive.summary: Increase natural max of one attribute by 1.

positive.name: First Impression
positive.summary: +2 dice to Social tests during first meetings.

positive.name: Focused Concentration
positive.summary: Sustain one spell/complex form equal to rating without penalty.

positive.name: Gearhead
positive.summary: +20% Speed or +1 Handling; +2 to stunts.

positive.name: Guts
positive.summary: +2 dice to resist fear and intimidation.

positive.name: High Pain Tolerance
positive.summary: Ignore 1 wound modifier per rating.

positive.name: Home Ground
positive.summary: Bonus in specific turf (Astral Acclimation, Digital Turf, etc.).

positive.name: Human-Looking
positive.summary: Pass for human. Restricted to Elf, Dwarf, Ork.

positive.name: Indomitable
positive.summary: +1 to Inherent Limits per level (Mental, Physical, or Social).

positive.name: Juryrigger
positive.summary: +2 dice to Mechanics for temporary fixes.

positive.name: Low-Light Vision
positive.summary: See in dim light without penalty.

positive.name: Lucky
positive.summary: Raise Edge natural maximum by 1.

positive.name: Magical Resistance
positive.summary: +1 die to Spell Resistance Tests per rating. Cannot be turned off.

positive.name: Mentor Spirit
positive.summary: Gain mentor spirit benefits/drawbacks.

positive.name: Natural Athlete
positive.summary: +2 dice to Running and Gymnastics.

positive.name: Natural Hardening
positive.summary: +1 natural Biofeedback filtering.

positive.name: Natural Immunity
positive.summary: Immunity to one specific disease or toxin.

positive.name: Photographic Memory
positive.summary: Perfect recall; +2 dice to Memory tests.

positive.name: Quick Healer
positive.summary: +2 dice to all Healing tests.

positive.name: Resistance to Pathogens/Toxins
positive.summary: +1 dice pool modifier to Resistance Tests.

positive.name: Spirit Affinity
positive.summary: Attuned to one spirit type; +1 service/binding bonus.

positive.name: Thermographic Vision
positive.summary: See heat signatures.

positive.name: Toughness
positive.summary: +1 die to Body for Damage Resistance.

positive.name: Will to Live
positive.summary: +1 Overflow box per rating.

negative.name: Addiction
negative.summary: Physical or physiological dependence on a substance.

negative.name: Allergy
negative.summary: Allergenic reaction to a substance or condition.

negative.name: Astral Beacon
negative.summary: Highly visible astral signature; lasts twice as long.

negative.name: Bad Luck
negative.summary: Edge occasionally backfires (1 on d6).

negative.name: Bad Rep
negative.summary: Start with 3 Notoriety.

negative.name: Code of Honor
negative.summary: Bound by strict rules about who may be harmed.

negative.name: Codeblock
negative.summary: -2 dice on one specific Matrix action.

negative.name: Combat Paralysis
negative.summary: First Initiative halved; –3 on Surprise tests.

negative.name: Dependents
negative.summary: Loved ones require time/resources. Increases lifestyle cost.

negative.name: Distinctive Style
negative.summary: Memorable; +2 dice to identify/trace you.

negative.name: Elf Poser
negative.summary: Human posing as an elf. Social stigma.

negative.name: Gremlins
negative.summary: Tech malfunctions more around you.

negative.name: Incompetent
negative.summary: Cannot use one skill group.

negative.name: Insomnia
negative.summary: May double Stun recovery time. Severe causes chronic fatigue.

negative.name: Loss of Confidence
negative.summary: -2 dice pool modifier for a specific skill.

negative.name: Low Pain Tolerance
negative.summary: Wound modifiers every 2 boxes instead of 3.

negative.name: Ork Poser
negative.summary: Pose as an Ork. Social Stigma.

negative.name: Prejudiced
negative.summary: Bias against specific group. Social penalties.

negative.name: Scorched
negative.summary: Flashbacks/neurological issues from BTL/Black IC.

negative.name: Sensitive System
negative.summary: Double Essence cost for cyberware. Bioware rejected.

negative.name: Simsense Vertigo
negative.summary: -2 to tests when using AR/VR/Simsense.

negative.name: SINner
negative.summary: Legal status and tax obligations.

negative.name: Social Stress
negative.summary: Emotional triggers interfere with interactions.

negative.name: Spirit Bane
negative.summary: Spirits of a specific type are hostile.

negative.name: Uncouth
negative.summary: –2 dice to resist social impulses; double Karma for Social skills.

negative.name: Uneducated
negative.summary: Cannot default Technical/Academic skills.

negative.name: Unsteady Hands
negative.summary: -2 Agility tests when stressed/shaking.

negative.name: Weak Immune System
negative.summary: Disease Power +2 against you.

lifestyles.name: Street
lifestyles.description: Living on the streets with no permanent shelter.

lifestyles.name: Low
lifestyles.description: A small apartment in a rough neighborhood.

lifestyles.name: Medium
lifestyles.description: A comfortable apartment with basic amenities.

lifestyles.name: High
lifestyles.description: Upscale housing in a secure neighborhood.

lifestyles.name: Luxury
lifestyles.description: The finest accommodations money can buy.

armor.name: Armor Clothing
armor.description: Fashionable clothing with hidden armor weave.

armor.name: Chameleon Suit
armor.description: Thermoptic camouflage suit with ruthenium coating.

armor.name: Lined Coat
armor.description: Long armored coat popular with street samurai.

cyberdecks.name: Fairlight Excalibur
cyberdecks.description: The legendary Excalibur - the best money can buy.

electronics.name: Directional Jammer
electronics.description: Jams wireless signals in a cone (Rating 1-6).

electronics.name: Area Jammer
electronics.description: Jams wireless signals in an area (Rating 1-6).

ammunition.name: Flechette Ammo (100)
ammunition.description: Flechette rounds (+2 DV vs unarmored, +5 AP).

catalog.name: Datajack
catalog.description: Standard neural interface for DNI. Allows connection to electronic devices.
catalog.wirelessBonus: Can switch between devices and maintain multiple connections without physical contact.

catalog.name: Control Rig (Rating 1)
catalog.description: VCR for controlling vehicles and drones. +1 to vehicle tests.

catalog.name: Cortex Bomb (Kink)
catalog.description: Cranial explosive for security/control. Kink model causes disabling pain.

catalog.name: Cortex Bomb (Area)
catalog.description: Cranial explosive with area effect. 15P, -6 AP, -1/m.

catalog.name: Olfactory Booster
catalog.description: Enhanced sense of smell. +Rating to smell-based Perception tests.

catalog.name: Taste Booster
catalog.description: Enhanced taste sensitivity. +Rating to taste analysis tests.

catalog.name: Tooth Compartment
catalog.description: Hollow tooth for concealing small items.

catalog.name: Ultrasound Sensor
catalog.description: Sonar imaging system. Can 'see' in complete darkness.

catalog.name: Voice Modulator
catalog.description: Modify vocal patterns. +Rating to vocal impersonation.

catalog.name: Cybereyes (Rating 1)
catalog.description: Replacement eyes with 4 capacity for upgrades.
catalog.wirelessBonus: When wirelessly enabled, gives +1 limit to Perception tests.

catalog.name: Cybereyes (Rating 2)
catalog.wirelessBonus: When wirelessly enabled, gives +2 limit to Perception tests.

catalog.name: Cybereyes (Rating 3)
catalog.wirelessBonus: When wirelessly enabled, gives +3 limit to Perception tests.

catalog.name: Cybereyes (Rating 4)
catalog.wirelessBonus: When wirelessly enabled, gives +4 limit to Perception tests.

catalog.name: Low-Light Vision
catalog.description: See in low-light conditions as if fully lit.

catalog.name: Thermographic Vision
catalog.description: Infrared vision to see heat signatures.

catalog.name: Damper
catalog.description: Protection from loud noises. Negates audio-based attacks.

catalog.name: Bone Lacing (Plastic)
catalog.description: +1 Body for damage resistance. Unarmed DV +1.

catalog.name: Bone Lacing (Aluminum)
catalog.description: +2 Body for damage resistance. Unarmed DV +2.

catalog.name: Bone Lacing (Titanium)
catalog.description: +3 Body for damage resistance. Unarmed DV +3.

catalog.name: Platelet Factories
catalog.description: +1 die to resist bleeding. Reduces Overflow threshold penalty.

catalog.name: Suprathyroid Gland
catalog.description: +1 to all physical attributes (BOD, AGI, REA, STR).

catalog.name: Obvious Cyberarm
catalog.description: Full cybernetic arm. Base stats: AGI 3, STR 3.

catalog.name: Synthetic Cyberarm
catalog.description: Realistic-looking cyberarm. Base stats: AGI 3, STR 3.

catalog.name: Obvious Cyberleg
catalog.description: Full cybernetic leg. Base stats: AGI 3, STR 3.

catalog.name: Synthetic Cyberleg
catalog.description: Realistic-looking cyberleg. Base stats: AGI 3, STR 3.

catalog.name: Obvious Cyberhand
catalog.description: Replacement hand. Base stats: AGI 3, STR 3.

catalog.name: Obvious Cyberfoot
catalog.description: Replacement foot. Base stats: AGI 3, STR 3.

catalog.name: Gyromount
catalog.description: Arm-mounted weapon stabilization system. Negates recoil penalties.

catalog.name: Hand Blade
catalog.description: Retractable blade in forearm. Reach 0, DV (STR+2)P, AP -2.

catalog.name: Hand Razors
catalog.description: Retractable finger blades. Reach 0, DV (STR+1)P, AP -3.

catalog.name: Adrenaline Pump (Rating 1)
catalog.description: +1 BOD, AGI, REA, STR when activated. Costs Edge.

catalog.name: Adrenaline Pump (Rating 2)
catalog.description: +2 BOD, AGI, REA, STR when activated. Costs Edge.

catalog.name: Adrenaline Pump (Rating 3)
catalog.description: +3 BOD, AGI, REA, STR when activated. Costs Edge.

catalog.name: Enhanced Articulation
catalog.description: +1 to Escape Artist tests and Physical Limit.

catalog.name: Platelet Factories (Bioware)
catalog.description: +1 die to resist bleeding. Reduces Overflow threshold penalty.

catalog.name: Reflex Recorder
catalog.description: +1 die to skill linked to implant.

catalog.name: Skin Pocket
catalog.description: Concealed pocket in skin for small items.

catalog.name: Suprathyroid Gland
catalog.description: +1 to all physical attributes (BOD, AGI, REA, STR).

catalog.name: Mnemonic Enhancer (Rating 1)
catalog.description: +1 to memory tests. +1 to Knowledge skill maximums.

catalog.name: Mnemonic Enhancer (Rating 2)
catalog.description: +2 to memory tests. +2 to Knowledge skill maximums.

catalog.name: Mnemonic Enhancer (Rating 3)
catalog.description: +3 to memory tests. +3 to Knowledge skill maximums.

catalog.name: Pain Editor
catalog.description: Ignore all wound modifiers. Requires Willpower (3) to activate.

catalog.name: Sleep Regulator
catalog.description: Only need 3 hours of sleep per day.

catalog.name: Synaptic Booster (Rating 1)
catalog.description: +1 REA, +1D6 Initiative. Incompatible with wired reflexes.

catalog.name: Synaptic Booster (Rating 2)
catalog.description: +2 REA, +2D6 Initiative. Incompatible with wired reflexes.

catalog.name: Synaptic Booster (Rating 3)
catalog.description: +3 REA, +3D6 Initiative. Incompatible with wired reflexes.

creationMethods.name: Priority System
creationMethods.description: Assign priorities A-E to Metatype, Attributes, Magic/Resonance, Skills, and Resources. Each priority used exactly once.

steps.title: Augmentations
steps.description: Install cyberware and bioware augmentations. Essence loss reduces Magic/Resonance.

steps.title: Spells
steps.description: Select spells if you are a magician or mystic adept.

steps.title: Adept Powers
steps.description: Select adept powers using your Power Points (equal to Magic for Adepts).

steps.title: Build Contacts
steps.description: Build your network of contacts using free Karma based on Charisma.

steps.title: Spend Karma
steps.description: Spend remaining Karma on spells, complex forms, or stat improvements. Max 7 Karma carryover.

budgets.label: Contact Karma
budgets.description: Free Karma for contacts = CHA x 3

constraints.description: Each priority level (A-E) must be used exactly once.
constraints.errorMessage: Each priority can only be assigned to one category.

constraints.description: Only one attribute can be at natural maximum at creation.
constraints.errorMessage: Only one attribute can be at its natural maximum.
Cannot spend more than 25 Karma on positive qualities.
Cannot gain more than 25 Karma from negative qualities.

constraints.description: Skills capped at 6 at creation (7 with Aptitude).
constraints.errorMessage: Skill rating cannot exceed 6 at creation (7 with Aptitude).

constraints.description: Gear availability cannot exceed 12 at creation.
constraints.errorMessage: Cannot purchase gear with availability higher than 12.
